panels.description: Amount of data transferred to and from disk.
panels.title: I/O bandwidth

panels.description: Completed disk I/O operations. Keep in mind the number of operations requested might be higher, since the system is able to merge adjacent to each other.
panels.title: I/O operations

panels.description: Disk Utilization measures the amount of time the disk was busy with something. This is not related to its performance. 100% means that the system always had an outstanding operation on the disk. Keep in mind that depending on the underlying technology of the disk, 100% here may or may not be an indication of congestion.
panels.title: Disks Utilization

panels.description: I/O operations currently in progress. This metric is a snapshot - it is not an average over the last interval.
panels.title: Queued operations

panels.description: The average service time for completed I/O operations. This metric is calculated using the total busy time of the disk and the number of completed operations. If the disk is able to execute multiple parallel operations the reporting average service time will be misleading.
panels.title: Average Service Time

panels.description: Backlog is an indication of the duration of pending disk operations. On every I/O event the system is multiplying the time spent doing I/O since the last update of this field with the number of pending operations. While not accurate, this metric can provide an indication of the expected completion time of the operations in progress.
panels.title: Disks backlog

panels.description: The sum of the duration of all completed I/O operations. This number can exceed the interval if the disk is able to execute I/O operations in parallel.
panels.title: Disk Total I/O Time

panels.description: The number of merged disk operations. The system is able to merge adjacent I/O operations, for example two 4KB reads can become one 8KB read before given to disk.
panels.title: Disk Merged Operations

panels.description: The average time for I/O requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.
panels.title: Average Completed I/O Operation Time

panels.description:
- inuse: amount of currently used devices in MD array
- down: count of down devices in MD array (zero is ok here)
panels.title: Disks status

panels.description: Count of faulty devices in MD array
panels.title: Faulty devices
